skill.name: research-storage
skill.description: Research file storage conventions and templates for dokhak agents. Use when: (1) saving research results from research-collector or researcher agents, (2) reading cached research files, (3) checking if research exists for a section. Provides directory structure, file format templates, and naming conventions.
skill.summary: Research file storage conventions and templates for dokhak agents. Use when: (1) saving research res...
skill.author: BitYoungjae

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Only uses Read, Write, Glob tools scoped to .research/ directory. No network access, no external commands, no environment variable access.

content.value_statement: Research files become scattered and hard to find. This skill provides consistent storage conventions, naming patterns, and templates so research data stays organized and reusable across dokhak sessions.
actual_capabilities: Define research directory structure for .research/ folder
Create standardized research.md, summary.md, and sources.md templates
Resolve research directories using multi-tier search algorithm
Normalize chapter and section names for consistency
limitations: Does not perform actual research or web searches
Does not execute code or run external processes
Only provides conventions, requires other skills for research collection
Requires researcher or research-collector agent to create initial files

use_cases.title: Organize research cache
use_cases.description: Keep research organized across writing sessions so information can be reused and updated efficiently.

use_cases.title: Standardize file naming
use_cases.description: Apply consistent naming conventions so research files are easy to locate by chapter and section.

use_cases.title: Share research templates
use_cases.description: Provide standardized templates for research output so all agents produce consistent, reusable research files.

prompt_templates.title: Save new research
prompt_templates.scenario: Store research for a new section
prompt_templates.prompt: Save research for section {chapter}.{section} {title} to .research/sections/{path}/ using the research-storage conventions.

prompt_templates.title: Check existing research
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if research exists for section {chapter}.{section} {title} using the multi-tier resolution strategy.

prompt_templates.title: Read init research
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the init research summary from .research/init/summary.md and sources from .research/init/sources.md.

prompt_templates.title: Apply naming format
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate the canonical directory path for chapter {chapter}, section {section}, title {title} using the buildCanonicalPath function.

output_examples.input: Save research for section 3.1 'Getting Started' about Python basics
output: Saved research.md with key concepts, code examples, and pitfalls
Saved sources.md with primary and secondary source registry

best_practices: Use canonical naming format (zero-padded chapter, no-padded section, kebab-case slug)
Apply the multi-tier resolution strategy when checking for existing research
Follow the provided markdown templates for consistent research file structure
anti_patterns: Using hardcoded paths instead of buildCanonicalPath function
Skipping the multi-tier search when checking for existing research
Storing research outside the .research/ directory structure

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The research-storage skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code using Read, Write, and Glob tools.

faq.question: How many research files can this skill manage?
faq.answer: The skill manages unlimited research files organized by chapter and section within the .research/ directory structure.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with other dokhak skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Research-storage works with researcher, research-collector, writer, and structure-designer agents.

faq.question: Is my research data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads and writes to the .research/ directory. No data leaves your local project.

faq.question: Why is my research not being found?
faq.answer: Use the multi-tier resolution strategy. The skill handles naming variations like '1-2-intro' vs '01-2-intro' automatically.

faq.question: How is this different from a simple file storage tool?
faq.answer: This skill provides standardized naming, templates, and resolution algorithms specifically designed for research workflows.
